newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: SIMEX Brent untraded, marked lower with NYMEX.
newsitem.headline: SIMEX Brent untraded, marked lower with NYMEX.

text.p: Brent crude futures were untraded around midday on Friday with prices marked lower in line with modest weakness on NYMEX.
July Brent was quoted at $20.08/$20.15 per barrel, down from London's overnight settlement of $20.18.
August was quoted at $20.00/$20.15, down from the London close of $20.17.

Brokers said prices were stalled for the time being, finding little momentum on either side of the market. However, the crude market could look increasingly to NYMEX unleaded gasoline as Memorial Day in the U.S. on Monday traditionally marks the start of the gasoline season.
NYMEX July crude, trading on ACCESS, was last traded at $21.80, down six cents from New York.
June gasoline was last traded at 66.70 cents per gallon, down 0.23 cent from New York. However, ACCESS volume on June was a slight 44 lots.
SIMEX and IPE Brent, plus NYMEX energy futures are closed on Monday to mark national holidays in the U.K. and the U.S..
